titleStmt.title: Apollo to Dean Swift on ye Foregoing

lg.l: Right trusty & so forth── we'd have you to know
We are very ill Us'd by you Mortalls below
For first I have often by chimists been told
Tho I know nothing on't) it is I that make Gold
Which when you have Got you so Carefully hide it
That sence I was born I scarce once have spid it
Then it must be allow'd whereever I Shine
That I forword ye Grass & ri\p·over·i\ne ye Vine
To me ye good fellows Apply for relief
Without whom they cou'd neither get Clarit or beef,
Yet theire Wine and their Victualls these Curmudgon Labard
Lo\del·c·add·o\k \add·up\ from \add·my\ Sight in Pantrys & Cubbards
That I've an ill Eye they Maliciously think
and taint all their Meat & sour all their drink
But thirdly & lastly it Must be allowd
I alone can Inspire the Poeticall Croud
This is gratefull own'd by each boy in ye College
(Whom if I inspire its not to My knowledge)
This every pretender in Rhime will admitt
Without troubling his head about Judgmt: or witt
These Gentlemen Use me with kindness & freedom
And as for their works when I Please I can read them
they lie open on purpose on Counters & Stalls
and their titles I view when I Shine on ye walls
But a Comrade of yours yt Trayter Delany
Whom I for yr Sake have uesd better then any
and of my meer motion and speciall Good Grace
Intended in time should succeed in yr Place
on teusday ye tenth Seditiously came
with a cartain false Prayteress one Stella by Name ·Mrs Johnson.
To ye Deanery House & on ye North Glass
where for fear of ye cold I never can Pass
Then & there with a cartain Utensil
of Value five Shilling (in English a pencill)
Did Maliciously falsly & traiterously write
While Stella aforesaid stood by ye Light
My Sister has latly deposs'd on oath
She Stop'd in her course to look on 'em both
That Stella was helping & abetting & aiding
and Still as he wrote Stood Smiling & reading
That her Eyes was as bright as my Self at noon day
But her Graceful black locks were mingl'd wth Gray
And by ye Discription I certainly know
Tis ye Nymph whom I courted Some ten Years agoe
Whom when I with ye best of my tallants endow'd
on her Promise of yeilding She Acted ye Prude
That Some verses were wrote with fellonious Intent
Direct to ye North where I never went
That ye Letters appear'd reverse on ye Paine
but in Stellas bright Eyes were set right again
where in She could distinctly read every line
and presently Guesst ye fancy was mine
She can Swear She often has seen
at between Cavan Street & College Green
now you See why his verses So Seldom are Shown
The reason is Plain they are none of his own
and observe while you live that no man is shy
To Discover ye Good he came honestly by
If I light on a thought he'll certainly ste\add·a\ll it
and when he has Stole it find ways to conceal it
of all ye fine things he keeps in ye Dark
There's Scarce on in ten that has not my mark
om.
om.
But as for ye Poem he wrote on ye Sash
om.
My Sister transcrib'd it Last night to his Sorrow
and ye Publick Shall See it if I Live to Morrow
Thro' the Sodiack around it Shall Quickly be Spread
In all \add·ye\ Parts of ye world where yr Language is read
He know very well I never give a Refusuall
when I ask'd for my aid in ye forms yt are us\add·u\al
But ye Secerit is this I did Latly Intend
To write a few verses on you as a freind
I stud'd a fortnight before I could find
as I wrode in my Charriott athought to my Mind
And resolve'd ye next Winter for that is my time
When ye days are at Shortest to put in Rhime
Till then it was Lock'd in my box a Parnassus
When them Subtle companions resolv'd to Surpass us
Conveys out my paper of hints by a trick
for I think in my Concience he Deals with old nick
Get me to a window beyond both ye Tropics
And from my own Stock Provided with Topics
There out of my Sight just again ye north Zone
writes down my conceits & calls them his own
and you like a Cully ye Bubble can Swallow
and who but Delany can write like Apollo
High Treason by by Statute but here you object
he only Stole Hints ye verse is correct
Tho' ye thoughts be apollos tis finely Express'd
So a theif Stealls my horse & has him well Drest
Now whereas ye Said Criminall Seems Past repentance
We Phebus think fitt to proceed to his Sentence
Sence Delany has dar'd like Promethennis Sire
To Clime to our Region & thence to Steal fire
We order a Vulture in Shape of ye Spleen
To Pray on his liver but not to be Seen
and we order our Subjects of every degree\del·s\
To \del·all·add·beleive\ all his Verses were Written by Me.
and under ye Pain of our highest Displeasure
To call nothing his but ye Rhime & ye Measure.
and Lastly for Stella ·Mrs Johnson. just out of her Prime
I'm too much Revenged already by time
In return of Her Scorn I sent her Diseases
and will now be her freind when ever She Pleases
The Gifts I bestow'd her will find her a lover
Tho She lives till Shes Gray as a Badger all over
